name: IBPS Clerk
description: A Common Written Examination (CWE) conducted annually by the Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) for the recruitment of individuals for Clerical Cadre posts in multiple Public Sector Banks across India.

eligibility.ageLimit: 20 to 28 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved category candidates as per government rules.
eligibility.educationalQualification: A Degree (Graduation) in any discipline from a University recognised by the Govt. Of India. Candidates must also have proficiency in the Official Language of the State/UT they are applying for and possess operating and working knowledge in computer systems.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India or a subject of Nepal or Bhutan, or a Tibetan Refugee who came over to India before 1st January 1962 with the intention of permanently settling in India.

timeline.notificationDate: Expected in July 2024 (For 2023, it was July 1, 2023)
timeline.examDate: Prelims: August 24, 25 & 31, 2024. Mains: October 13, 2024 (As per IBPS Calendar 2024-25)
timeline.resultDate: Final allotment result is typically declared on April 1 of the following year.

stages.name: Stage 1: Preliminary Examination
stages.description: An online objective test of 100 marks with a duration of 1 hour (60 minutes), comprising 3 sections with individual timings. This stage is qualifying in nature.

stages.name: Stage 2: Main Examination
stages.description: An online objective test of 200 marks with 190 questions. The duration is 160 minutes with sectional timings. Marks obtained in the Main exam are considered for the final merit list. There is no interview for the Clerk post.

stages.name: Stage 3: Language Proficiency Test (LPT)
stages.description: Candidates who are not proficient in the official language of the State/UT they have applied for will be subjected to an LPT. It is qualifying in nature.

examPattern.markingScheme: For both Preliminary and Main exams, 1/4th (or 0.25) of the marks assigned to a question will be deducted for each wrong answer.

syllabus.name: Preliminary Exam: Numerical Ability
topics: Arithmetic Word Problems (Percentage, Profit & Loss, Time & Work, etc.)

syllabus.name: Main Exam: General/Financial Awareness
topics: Static GK (Countries & Capitals, Important Days, etc.)

syllabus.name: Main Exam: Reasoning Ability & Computer Aptitude
